page.title: 02The School at Dinnington
page.content: The first pupils moved into the present building in 1961 but there has been a school in{DINNINGTON}since 1827 and the{Old School}built in 1871 still remains. There are now four classes taking children aged 4-9 years and a nursery unit for children of 3. There is a big school field and a schoolyard with games and a map of the world painted on the ground. On the South side of the school is a{Checkerboard {Garden, }an area of paving stones and patches of soil,each class tends a plot. Vegetables, flowers,herbs and grasses are grown, there is also a pond. A kitchen prepares lunches these cost 60p for two courses, food such as fish and chips, sausage, beefburgers meat,mince and cheesepie, pizza, salad and curry is served. We can see aeroplanes taking off and landing at the Airport from our room.
